snippet: The league is threatening the record total of fourth-quarter comebacks, because of an emphasis on passing, rules inhibiting defenses, better place-kickers and the popularity of hurry-up offenses.
abstract: Number of last-minute comebacks have been on rise in NFL games since 2010; some theories as to why include sloppy fundamentals, more use of quick-strike offensive plays, and rule changes concerning illegal contact by defense.
lead_paragraph: The league is threatening the record total of fourth-quarter comebacks, because of an emphasis on passing, rules inhibiting defenses, better place-kickers and the popularity of hurry-up offenses.

headline.main: An N.F.L. Season of Bitter (or Sweet) Comebacks
headline.print_headline: That Rarity, the Last-Minute Comeback, Is Happening Quite a Bit More
